entry.title: iOS Onboarding: Part One
entry.content:
FirstTimeUser or Nah?

User Defaults

We can determine if a user is a first time user by setting boolean flags via UserDefaults, which Apple defines UserDefaults as:

An interface to the userâ€™s defaults database, where you store key-value pairs persistently across launches of your app.

I find UserDefaults very useful for determine things like:

  • is a customer a first time user?
  • is a customer a beta tester?

entry.title: why blog?
entry.content:
Intentions vs Goals

The road to failure is made easier by good intentions

I intend to write but experience has proven that intent is not a good motivator; I need to know why and how an action maps to a goal.

My current goals are:

  • stop googling around for solutions to the same problems
  • a single repository for documenting problems/solutions
  • a single repository for sharing and discussing ideas

Writing address all 3.
